description: If ADSL act rate is lower than threshold
hwTrapType is 1. Otherwise, hwTrapType is 2.
This trap message is generated when the ADSL port rate fails to meet the requirement.

event.Summary: ADSL port ACT rate is lower than threshold

description: A slot index is used to identify the location of a board in a shelf.
You can locate a board in a shelf according to hwFrameIndex and hwSlotIndex.
For the hwFrameIndex object, refer to hwFrameTable.
variables.name: HUAWEI-DEVICE-MIB::hwSlotIndex

description: Port index, indicating the physical number of the port on a board.
variables.name: HUAWEI-DEVICE-MIB::hwPortIndex

description: Port operation status.
Options:
1.normal(1) -indicates that the link is up or activated
2.fault(2) -indicates that port failure
3.localLoopback(3) -indicates that normal local loopback
4.forbidden(4) -indicates that the port is disabled
5.test(5) -indicates test start
6.remoteLoopback(6) -indicates normal remote loopback
7.activated(10) -indicates that the port is being activated
8.deactivated(11) -indicates that the link is down or deactivated
9.block(12) -indicates port blocking
10.nolight(13) -indicates no signal in ATM port
11.innerLocalLoopback(14) -indicates that inner local loopback toward inner system chipset (it's UTOPIA loopback for ADSL port)
12.innerRemoteLoopback(15)-indicates that inner remote loopback toward inner system chipset
13.locked(16) -indicates locked
14.busy(17) -indicates busy
15.maintain(18) -indicates maintenance
16.standbynormal(19) -indicates that the port on the standby control board is activated
17.standbyfault(20) -indicates that the port on the standby control board is faulty
18.adslloopbackafe(21) -indicates that AFE loopback
19.adslloopbackhybrid(22) -indicates that HYBRID loopback
20.rtuLocalLoopback(23) -indicates that RTU local loopback
21.rtuRemoteLoopback(24) -indicates that RTU remote loopback
22.linkup(25) -indicates eth port online
23.linkdown(26) -indicates eth port offline
24.powerDenied(50) -indicates port operation state is power denied
variables.name: HUAWEI-DEVICE-MIB::hwPortOperStatus

description: The primary status of the port.
Options:
1. isNr(1) -in Service, normal
2. isAnr(2) -in service, abnormal
3. isRst(3) -in service, restricted
4. isAnrst(4) -in service, abnormal & restricted
5. oosAu(5) -out of service, autonomous
6. oosMa(6) -out of service, management
7. oosAuma(7) -out of service, autonomous & management
8. oosAurst(8) -out of service, autonomous & restricted
9. oosMaanr(9) -out of service, management & abnormal
variables.name: HUAWEI-DEVICE-MIB::hwPortPrimaryStatus

description: The secondary status of the port.
This BITS structure can report the following status:
1. sstAins(0) -this bit position positively reports that the status of the port is automatic in-service
2. sstFaf(1) -facility failure
3. sstFlt(2) -fault
4. sstLpbk(3) -loopback
5. sstMea(4) -mismatch of equipment and attributes
6. sstSgeo(5) -supporting entity outage
7. sstStbyh(6) -standby-Hot
8. sstTs(7) -test
9. sstUas(8) -unassigned
10. sstUeq(9) -unequipped
11. sstWrk(10) -working
12. sstPwr(11) -power
variables.name: HUAWEI-DEVICE-MIB::hwPortSecondaryStatus

description: ADSL selt test start trap.
This trap message is generated when the ADSL port selt test finish.

Summary.eval: ($v1 == 1) ? 'ADSL selt test successful' : 'ADSL selt test failed'

description: ADSL selt test start result.
Options:
1. normal - A message is returned indicating that the SELT is successful.
2. failed - A message is returned indicating that the SELT fails.
variables.name: HUAWEI-ADSL-EXT-MIB::hwadslSeltTestStartResult

description: The serial IP of configuration changes.
If the configuration changes is trigger by the command line users, the IP address is 0.0.0.0.
If it is triggered by the SNMP user, the IP address is the SNMP user's IP address.
The Trap of configuration changes will not be sent to the SNMP user
who triggered the configuration changes.
variables.name: HUAWEI-DEVICE-MIB::hwConfigChangeIP

description: ADSL profile operate type.
Options:
1.add(1) - Add an ADSL profile
2.modify(2) - Modify an ADSL profile
3.delete(3) - Delete an ADSL profile
variables.name: HUAWEI-ADSL-EXT-MIB::hwADSLProfOperType

description: This object is used by the line configuration table
in order to identify a row of this table.
When `dynamic' profiles are implemented, the profile
name is user specified. Also, the system will always
provide a default profile whose name is `DEFVAL'.
When `static' profiles are implemented, there is an
one-to-one relationship between each line and its
profile. In which case, the profile name will
need to algorithmicly represent the Line's ifIndex.
Therefore, the profile's name is a decimalized string
of the ifIndex that is fixed-length (i.e., 10) with
leading zero(s). For example, the profile name for
ifIndex which equals '15' will be '0000000015'.
variables.name: ADSL-LINE-MIB::adslLineConfProfileName

description: Defines what form of transmit rate adaptation is
configured on this modem. See ADSL Forum TR-005 [3]
for more information.
variables.name: ADSL-LINE-MIB::adslAtucConfRateMode

description: This object is used to configure the ADSL physical
line mode. It has following valid values:
noChannel(1), when no channels exist.
fastOnly(2), when only fast channel exists.
interleavedOnly(3), when only interleaved channel
exist.
fastOrInterleaved(4), when either fast or
interleaved channels can exist, but only one
at any time.
fastAndInterleaved(5), when both the fast channel
and the interleaved channel exist.
In the case when no value has been set, the default
Value is noChannel(1).
variables.name: ADSL-LINE-EXT-MIB::adslConfProfileLineType

description: Configured Target Signal/Noise Margin.
This is the Noise Margin the modem must achieve
with a BER of 10-7 or better to successfully complete
initialization.
variables.name: ADSL-LINE-MIB::adslAtucConfTargetSnrMgn

description: Configured Maximum acceptable Signal/Noise Margin.
If the Noise Margin is above this the modem should
attempt to reduce its power output to optimize its
operation.
variables.name: ADSL-LINE-MIB::adslAtucConfMaxSnrMgn

description: Configured Minimum acceptable Signal/Noise Margin.
If the noise margin falls below this level, the modem
should attempt to increase its power output. If that
is not possible the modem will attempt to
re-initialize or shut down.
variables.name: ADSL-LINE-MIB::adslAtucConfMinSnrMgn

description: Configured Signal/Noise Margin for rate downshift.
If the noise margin falls below this level, the modem
should attempt to decrease its transmit rate. In
the case that RADSL is not present, the value will
variables.name: ADSL-LINE-MIB::adslAtucConfDownshiftSnrMgn

description: Configured Signal/Noise Margin for rate upshift.
If the noise margin rises above this level, the modem
should attempt to increase its transmit rate. In
the case that RADSL is not present, the value will
variables.name: ADSL-LINE-MIB::adslAtucConfUpshiftSnrMgn

description: Minimum time that the current margin is above
UpshiftSnrMgn before an upshift occurs.
In the case that RADSL is not present, the value will
variables.name: ADSL-LINE-MIB::adslAtucConfMinUpshiftTime

description: Minimum time that the current margin is below
DownshiftSnrMgn before a downshift occurs.
In the case that RADSL is not present, the value will
variables.name: ADSL-LINE-MIB::adslAtucConfMinDownshiftTime

description: Configured Minimum Transmit rate for `Fast' channels
in bps. See adslAtucConfRateChanRatio for information
regarding RADSL mode and ATUR transmit rate for
ATUC receive rates.
variables.name: ADSL-LINE-MIB::adslAtucChanConfFastMinTxRate

description: Configured Minimum Transmit rate for `Interleave'
channels, in bps. See adslAtucConfRateChanRatio for
information regarding RADSL mode and see
ATUR transmit rate for receive rates.
variables.name: ADSL-LINE-MIB::adslAtucChanConfInterleaveMinTxRate

description: Configured Maximum Transmit rate for `Fast' channels
in bps. See adslAtucConfRateChanRatio for information
regarding RADSL mode and see ATUR transmit rate for
ATUC receive rates.
variables.name: ADSL-LINE-MIB::adslAtucChanConfFastMaxTxRate

description: Configured Maximum Transmit rate for `Interleave'
channels, in bps. See adslAtucConfRateChanRatio for
information regarding RADSL mode and ATUR transmit
rate for ATUC receive rates.
variables.name: ADSL-LINE-MIB::adslAtucChanConfInterleaveMaxTxRate

description: Configured maximum Interleave Delay for this channel.
Interleave delay applies only to the interleave channel
and defines the mapping (relative spacing) between
subsequent input bytes at the interleaver input and
their placement in the bit stream at the interleaver
output. Larger numbers provide greater separation
between consecutive input bytes in the output bit
stream allowing for improved impulse noise immunity
at the expense of payload latency.
variables.name: ADSL-LINE-MIB::adslAtucChanConfMaxInterleaveDelay

description: Configured Target Signal/Noise Margin.
This is the Noise Margin the modem must achieve
with a BER of 10-7 or better to successfully complete
initialization.
variables.name: ADSL-LINE-MIB::adslAturConfTargetSnrMgn

description: Configured Maximum acceptable Signal/Noise Margin.
If the Noise Margin is above this the modem should
attempt to reduce its power output to optimize its
operation.
variables.name: ADSL-LINE-MIB::adslAturConfMaxSnrMgn

description: Configured Minimum acceptable Signal/Noise Margin.
If the noise margin falls below this level, the modem
should attempt to increase its power output. If that
is not possible the modem will attempt to
re-initialize or shut down.
variables.name: ADSL-LINE-MIB::adslAturConfMinSnrMgn

description: Configured Signal/Noise Margin for rate downshift.
If the noise margin falls below this level, the modem
should attempt to decrease its transmit rate. In
the case that RADSL is not present
the value will be `0'.
variables.name: ADSL-LINE-MIB::adslAturConfDownshiftSnrMgn

description: Configured Signal/Noise Margin for rate upshift.
If the noise margin rises above this level, the modem
should attempt to increase its transmit rate.
In the case that RADSL is not present
the value will be `0'.
variables.name: ADSL-LINE-MIB::adslAturConfUpshiftSnrMgn

description: Minimum time that the current margin is above
UpshiftSnrMgn before an upshift occurs.
In the case that RADSL is not present, the value will
variables.name: ADSL-LINE-MIB::adslAturConfMinUpshiftTime

description: Minimum time that the current margin is below
DownshiftSnrMgn before a downshift occurs.
In the case that RADSL is not present, the value will
variables.name: ADSL-LINE-MIB::adslAturConfMinDownshiftTime

description: Configured Minimum Transmit rate for `Fast' channels
in bps. See adslAturConfRateChanRatio for information
regarding RADSL mode and ATUC transmit rate
for ATUR receive rates.
variables.name: ADSL-LINE-MIB::adslAturChanConfFastMinTxRate

description: Configured Minimum Transmit rate for `Interleave'
channels, in bps. See adslAturConfRateChanRatio for
information regarding RADSL mode and ATUC transmit rate
for ATUR receive rates.
variables.name: ADSL-LINE-MIB::adslAturChanConfInterleaveMinTxRate

description: Configured Maximum Transmit rate for `Fast' channels
in bps. See adslAturConfRateChanRatio for information
regarding RADSL mode and ATUC transmit rate
for ATUR receive rates.
variables.name: ADSL-LINE-MIB::adslAturChanConfFastMaxTxRate

description: Configured Maximum Transmit rate for `Interleave'
channels, in bps. See adslAturConfRateChanRatio for
information regarding RADSL mode and see
ATUC transmit rate for ATUR receive rates.
variables.name: ADSL-LINE-MIB::adslAturChanConfInterleaveMaxTxRate

description: Configured maximum Interleave Delay for this channel.
Interleave delay applies only to the interleave channel
and defines the mapping (relative spacing) between
subsequent input bytes at the interleaver input and
their placement in the bit stream at the interleaver
output. Larger numbers provide greater separation
between consecutive input bytes in the output bit
stream allowing for improved impulse noise immunity
at the expense of payload latency.
variables.name: ADSL-LINE-MIB::adslAturChanConfMaxInterleaveDelay

description: Enables and disables the down bitswap of a template.
Options:
1. enabled(1) - Indicates that the downstream bit swap is enabled
2. disabled(2) - Indicates that the downstream bit swap is disabled
Default: enabled(1)
variables.name: HUAWEI-ADSL-MIB::hwAdslAtucConfDownBitSwap

description: Enables and disables the up bitswap of a template.
Options:
1. enabled(1) - Indicates that the upstream bit swap is enabled
2. disabled(2) - Indicates that the upstream bit swap is disabled
Default: enabled(1)
variables.name: HUAWEI-ADSL-MIB::hwAdslAtucConfUpBitSwap

description: Enables and disables the Trellions mode.
Options:
1. enabled(1) - Indicates that the trellis coding is enabled
2. disabled(2) - Indicates that the trellis coding is disabled
Default: enabled(1)
variables.name: HUAWEI-ADSL-MIB::hwAdslTrellionsModeEnable

description: Indicates the transmission mode of this channel.
Options:
2. fullRate(2) - Full rate(G992.1 or T1.413)
3. gliteOnly(3) - G992.2(g.lite) only
4. t1413Only(4) - T1.413 only
5. gdmtOnly(5) - G992.1,G992.3,G992.5,(g.dmt) only
12. adslAllOnly(12) - ADSL ALL ONLY
13. adslAndAdsl2(13) - G.992.1,G.992.3,T1.413(Not support)
Default: all(1)
variables.name: HUAWEI-ADSL-EXT-MIB::hwAdslTransmissionModeCfg

description: This object is used to configure the ADSL physical
line mode. It has following valid values:
noChannel(1), when no channels exist.
fastOnly(2), when only fast channel exists.
interleavedOnly(3), when only interleaved channel
exist.
fastOrInterleaved(4), when either fast or
interleaved channels can exist, but only one
at any time.
fastAndInterleaved(5), when both the fast channel
and the interleaved channel exist.
In the case when no value has been set, the default
Value is noChannel(1).
variables.name: ADSL-LINE-EXT-MIB::adslConfProfileLineType

description: ADSL alarm profile change trap.
This trap message is generated when the ADSL alarm profile changed.
objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD HUAWEI-ADSL-EXT-MIB::hwADSLAlarmProfChangeTrap HUAWEI-DEVICE-MIB::hwConfigChangeIP a 192.0.2.1 HUAWEI-ADSL-EXT-MIB::hwADSLProfOperType i 1 ADSL-LINE-MIB::adslLineAlarmConfProfileName s EXAMPLE ADSL-LINE-MIB::adslAtucThresh15MinLofs i 0 ADSL-LINE-MIB::adslAtucThresh15MinLoss i 0 ADSL-LINE-MIB::adslAtucThresh15MinLols i 0 ADSL-LINE-MIB::adslAtucThresh15MinLprs i 0 ADSL-LINE-MIB::adslAtucThresh15MinESs i 0 ADSL-LINE-MIB::adslAtucThreshFastRateUp i 9999 ADSL-LINE-MIB::adslAtucThreshInterleaveRateUp i 9999 ADSL-LINE-MIB::adslAtucThreshFastRateDown i 9999 ADSL-LINE-MIB::adslAtucThreshInterleaveRateDown i 9999 ADSL-LINE-MIB::adslAtucInitFailureTrapEnable i 1 ADSL-LINE-MIB::adslAturThresh15MinLofs i 0 ADSL-LINE-MIB::adslAturThresh15MinLoss i 0 ADSL-LINE-MIB::adslAturThresh15MinLprs i 0 ADSL-LINE-MIB::adslAturThresh15MinESs i 0 ADSL-LINE-MIB::adslAturThreshFastRateUp i 9999 ADSL-LINE-MIB::adslAturThreshInterleaveRateUp i 9999 ADSL-LINE-MIB::adslAturThreshFastRateDown i 9999 ADSL-LINE-MIB::adslAturThreshInterleaveRateDown i 9999 ADSL-LINE-MIB::adslLineAlarmConfProfileRowStatus i 1 ADSL-LINE-EXT-MIB::adslAtucThreshold15MinFailedFastR i 0 ADSL-LINE-EXT-MIB::adslAtucThreshold15MinSesL i 0 ADSL-LINE-EXT-MIB::adslAtucThreshold15MinUasL i 0 ADSL-LINE-EXT-MIB::adslAturThreshold15MinSesL i 0 ADSL-LINE-EXT-MIB::adslAturThreshold15MinUasL i 0 HUAWEI-ADSL-EXT-MIB::hwadslLineAlarmConfProfileDyingGaspCfg i 1 HUAWEI-ADSL-EXT-MIB::hwadslLineAlarmConfProfXturThresh15MinLeftrs u 0 HUAWEI-ADSL-EXT-MIB::hwAdslLineAlarmConfProfileActiveFailAlarmSwitch i 1

description: The serial IP of configuration changes.
If the configuration changes is trigger by the command line users, the IP address is 0.0.0.0.
If it is triggered by the SNMP user, the IP address is the SNMP user's IP address.
The Trap of configuration changes will not be sent to the SNMP user
who triggered the configuration changes.
variables.name: HUAWEI-DEVICE-MIB::hwConfigChangeIP

description: ADSL profile operate type.
Options:
1.add(1) - Add an ADSL profile
2.modify(2) - Modify an ADSL profile
3.delete(3) - Delete an ADSL profile
variables.name: HUAWEI-ADSL-EXT-MIB::hwADSLProfOperType

description: This object is used by the line alarm configuration
table in order to identify a row of this table.
When `dynamic' profiles are implemented, the profile
name is user specified. Also, the system will always
provide a default profile whose name is `DEFVAL'.
When `static' profiles are implemented, there is an
one-to-one relationship between each line and its
profile. In which case, the profile name will
need to algorithmicly represent the Line's ifIndex.
Therefore, the profile's name is a decimalized string
of the ifIndex that is fixed-length (i.e., 10) with
leading zero(s). For example, the profile name for
ifIndex which equals '15' will be '0000000015'.
variables.name: ADSL-LINE-MIB::adslLineAlarmConfProfileName

description: The number of Loss of Frame Seconds
encountered by an ADSL interface within any given 15
minutes performance data collection period, which
causes the SNMP agent to send an
adslAtucPerfLofsThreshTrap.
Limit of one trap will be sent for any one interval. A
value of `0' will disable the trap.
variables.name: ADSL-LINE-MIB::adslAtucThresh15MinLofs

description: The number of Loss of Signal Seconds
encountered by an ADSL interface within any given 15
minutes performance data collection period, which
causes the SNMP agent to send an
adslAtucPerfLossThreshTrap.
Limit of one trap will be sent for any one interval.
A value of `0' will disable the trap.
variables.name: ADSL-LINE-MIB::adslAtucThresh15MinLoss

description: The number of Loss of Link Seconds
encountered by an ADSL interface within any given 15
minutes performance data collection period, which
causes the SNMP agent to send an
adslAtucPerfLolsThreshTrap. Limit of one trap will
be sent for any one interval. A value of `0' will
disable the trap.
variables.name: ADSL-LINE-MIB::adslAtucThresh15MinLols

description: The number of Loss of Power Seconds
encountered by an ADSL interface within any given 15
minutes performance data collection period, which
causes the SNMP agent to send an
adslAtucPerfLprsThreshTrap.
Limit of one trap will be sent for any one interval.
A value of `0' will disable the trap.
variables.name: ADSL-LINE-MIB::adslAtucThresh15MinLprs

description: The number of Errored Seconds
encountered by an ADSL interface within any given 15
minutes performance data collection period, which
causes the SNMP agent to send an
adslAtucPerfESsThreshTrap.
Limit of one trap will be sent for any one interval.
A value of `0' will disable the trap.
variables.name: ADSL-LINE-MIB::adslAtucThresh15MinESs

description: Applies to `Fast' channels only.
Configured change in rate causing an
adslAtucRateChangeTrap. A trap is produced when:
ChanCurrTxRate >= ChanPrevTxRate plus the value of
this object. Set to `0' to disable.
variables.name: ADSL-LINE-MIB::adslAtucThreshFastRateUp

description: Applies to `Interleave' channels only.
Configured change in rate causing an
adslAtucRateChangeTrap. A trap is produced when:
ChanCurrTxRate >= ChanPrevTxRate plus the value of
this object. Set to `0' to disable.
variables.name: ADSL-LINE-MIB::adslAtucThreshInterleaveRateUp

description: Applies to `Fast' channels only.
Configured change in rate causing an
adslAtucRateChangeTrap. A trap is produced when:
ChanCurrTxRate <= ChanPrevTxRate minus the value of
this object. Set to `0' to disable.
variables.name: ADSL-LINE-MIB::adslAtucThreshFastRateDown

description: Applies to `Interleave' channels only.
Configured change in rate causing an
adslAtucRateChangeTrap. A trap is produced when:
ChanCurrTxRate <= ChanPrevTxRate minus the value of
this object. Set to `0' to disable.
variables.name: ADSL-LINE-MIB::adslAtucThreshInterleaveRateDown

description: Enables and disables the InitFailureTrap. This
object is defaulted disable(2).
variables.name: ADSL-LINE-MIB::adslAtucInitFailureTrapEnable

description: The number of Loss of Frame Seconds
encountered by an ADSL interface within any given 15
minutes performance data collection period, which
causes the SNMP agent to send an
adslAtucPerfLofsThreshTrap.
Limit of one trap will be sent for any one interval.
A value of `0' will disable the trap.
variables.name: ADSL-LINE-MIB::adslAturThresh15MinLofs

description: The number of Loss of Signal Seconds

adslAtucPerfLossThreshTrap.

description: The number of Loss of Power Seconds
encountered by an ADSL interface within any given 15

adslAtucPerfLprsThreshTrap.
Limit of one trap will be sent for any one interval.
A value of `0' will disable the trap.
variables.name: ADSL-LINE-MIB::adslAturThresh15MinLprs

description: The number of Errored Seconds
encountered by an ADSL interface within any given 15
minutes performance data collection period, which
causes the SNMP agent to send an
adslAtucPerfESsThreshTrap.
Limit of one trap will be sent for any one interval.
A value of `0' will disable the trap.
variables.name: ADSL-LINE-MIB::adslAturThresh15MinESs

description: Applies to `Fast' channels only.
Configured change in rate causing an
adslAtucRateChangeTrap. A trap is produced when:
ChanCurrTxRate >= ChanPrevTxRate plus the value of
this object. Set to `0' to disable.
variables.name: ADSL-LINE-MIB::adslAturThreshFastRateUp

description: Applies to `Interleave' channels only.
configured change in rate causing an
adslAtucRateChangeTrap. A trap is produced when:
ChanCurrTxRate >= ChanPrevTxRate plus the value of
this object. Set to `0' to disable.

description: Applies to `Fast' channels only.

description: Applies to `Interleave' channels only.
Configured change in rate causing an
adslAtucRateChangeTrap. A trap is produced when:
ChanCurrTxRate <= ChanPrevTxRate minus the value of
this object. Set to `0' to disable.
variables.name: ADSL-LINE-MIB::adslAturThreshInterleaveRateDown

description: This object is used to create a new row or modify or
delete an existing row in this table.
A profile activated by setting this object to
`active'. When `active' is set, the system
will validate the profile.
Before a profile can be deleted or taken out of
service, (by setting this object to `destroy' or
`outOfService') it must be first unreferenced
from all associated lines.
If the implementator of this MIB has chosen not
to implement `dynamic assignment' of profiles, this
object's MIN-ACCESS is read-only and its value
is always to be `active'.
variables.name: ADSL-LINE-MIB::adslLineAlarmConfProfileRowStatus

description: The first time the value of the corresponding
instance of adslAtucPerfCurr15MinFailedFastR
reaches or exceeds this value within a given
15-minute performance data collection period
an adslAtucFailedFastRThreshTrap notification
will be generated. The value '0' will disable
the notification. The default value of this
object is '0'.
variables.name: ADSL-LINE-EXT-MIB::adslAtucThreshold15MinFailedFastR

description: The first time the value of the corresponding
instance of adslAtucPerf15MinSesL reaches or
exceeds this value within a given 15-minute
performance data collection period, an
adslAtucSesLThreshTrap notification will be
generated. The value '0' will disable the
notification. The default value of this
object is '0'.
variables.name: ADSL-LINE-EXT-MIB::adslAtucThreshold15MinSesL

description: The first time the value of the corresponding
instance of adslAtucPerf15MinUasL reaches or
exceeds this value within a given 15-minute
performance data collection period, an
adslAtucUasLThreshTrap notification will be
generated. The value '0' will disable the
notification. The default value of this
object is '0'.
variables.name: ADSL-LINE-EXT-MIB::adslAtucThreshold15MinUasL

description: The first time the value of the corresponding
instance of adslAturPerf15MinSesL reaches or
exceeds this value within a given 15-minute
performance data collection period, an
adslAturSesLThreshTrap notification will be
generated. The value '0' will disable the
notification. The default value of this
object is '0'.
variables.name: ADSL-LINE-EXT-MIB::adslAturThreshold15MinSesL

description: The first time the value of the corresponding
instance of adslAturPerf15MinUasL reaches or
exceeds this value within a given 15-minute
performance data collection period, an
adslAturUasLThreshTrap notification will be
generated. The value '0' will disable the
notification. The default value of this
object is '0'.
variables.name: ADSL-LINE-EXT-MIB::adslAturThreshold15MinUasL

description: This object enables/disables the report of LOSS-OF-POWER
alarm in an ADSL line. This object is defaulted enable(1).
Options:
1. enable(1) - The report of LOSS-OF-POWER alarm in an ADSL line is enabled
2. disable(2) - The report of LOSS-OF-POWER alarm in an ADSL line is disabled
Default: enable(1)
variables.name: HUAWEI-ADSL-EXT-MIB::hwadslLineAlarmConfProfileDyingGaspCfg

description: A threshold for the hwAdslAturPerfCurr15MLeftrs counter
The value 0 means that no threshold is specified for the
associated counter.
Unit: seconds
variables.name: HUAWEI-ADSL-EXT-MIB::hwadslLineAlarmConfProfXturThresh15MinLeftrs

description: This object enable/disable the active fail alarm switch.

2. disable(2) - The active fail alarm switch is disabled
variables.name: HUAWEI-ADSL-EXT-MIB::hwAdslLineAlarmConfProfileActiveFailAlarmSwitch
